channel.title: HELP! I only use RAC bass!
channel.description:
Hello all,
I'm having a problem where I don't like how any of the bass instruments sound except the three RAC ones. I want to use other basses, and routinely will literally go through all of the sound packs and try different tone/shape adjustments, but always come back to RAC. And while I love the RAC ones, there are other sounds I'm looking for. Part of it might be the indie and house-ish sounds I'm inclined towards, but I'm curious what everyone else is using. What are some of your guys(and girls) favorite go-to basses and setups? Don't worry about the genre, I just want good sounds. If you could share some links to examples I'd appreciate it!
To give you one example of what I can't find, I often want just a basic natural bass such as is found in the Kygo super-hit "Stay":
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=bmwdpoNGmOU (1:16 and later at 2:12)
In truth it is simlilar to RAC but has more sustain and less definition. Anyone been able to get a basic sound like this? It seems simple but I can't quite get it.
Another example of similar sound Petit Biscuit @ 0:42 (https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=wuCK-oiE3rM) (close to Sounds of Vivrant "Lake")

item.title: HELP! I only use RAC bass!

item.title: HELP! I only use RAC bass!
item.dc:creator: EVERANGE
item.description:
Unfortunately, I have a similiar problem except I always use pepper and gravel as long bass notes. I don’t really use short bass notes as much, so I only use RAC basses in the background to sustain the overall note.
I hope this was helpful.

Read full topic
item.source: HELP! I only use RAC bass!

item.title: HELP! I only use RAC bass!
item.dc:creator: MrSerpent
item.description:
For my soft, flowy, ambient tunes I like to use a variety of bass sounds that sound very quiet.

RAC basses paw and purr are good for this but there are also some really good vanilla basses for this.

My current go-to basses that aren’t from RAC are Pepper and Crater, which, if tuned correctly, can provide the perfect soft sound I crave in my quiet songs.

In the past, I’ve also used Needy, Pasta, and Panda when I didn’t have as much soundpacks (which is what I used for Looking Back)

Interestingly enough it was Akyut who helped me understand how to program and use good bass melodies when he added the needy and pasta in the early stages of making Looking Back

Read full topic

There are probably so many good bass sounds on Auxy that just aren’t under the “bass” instrument section. And vintage keys has that really warm, natural sound that could work really well.

item.title: HELP! I only use RAC bass!
item.dc:creator: Morgen
item.description:
@DH0, that’s actually a great idea. I really like Autumn, and could just use lower ranges as a sub/reinforcement bass. Interestingly, over the last few days as I’ve been listening to popular artists trying to figure out what they use, I think this is a common method I never thought of. Like using pad sounds, etc. in the low range instead of always just using “bass” instruments.

Read full topic
item.source: HELP! I only use RAC bass!

item.title: HELP! I only use RAC bass!
item.dc:creator: Morgen
item.description:
Yeah, don’t get me wrong, I LOVE RAC, just trying to expand my horizons .
@Trey mentioned gravel too, and I’m really liking it. I’ll try those others out! Come to think of it, I have used Flag as well, time to re-visit.

Read full topic
item.source: HELP! I only use RAC bass!

item.title: HELP! I only use RAC bass!
item.dc:creator: Morgen
item.description:
Yeah for sure @anon73773654, it is a weird sound! That’s a perfect example of how certain instruments can seem almost useless outside of their original context, but really good in the right genre, etc. That weird sound was actually really popular in the 90s for a sound called “acid” (i.e. acid techno, etc.). Actually, in one of arguably the most epic build-ups/drops in electronic history a dj in the 90s took that sound to the max and everyone would go crazy everytime it played. here it is:

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Ldfc68bxlB8 (start at 3:00)

here’s another good acid example: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=TguJjg-p2mE

That’s actually one thing I was hoping to get out of this thread, to hear bass’s in their “right context” so I could tap into the potential of those sounds!

Read full topic
item.source: HELP! I only use RAC bass!
